title: Graph-Based Machine Learning for Predictive Modeling in Complex Network Data
authors: Salman Basha Sheik, Palem Praveen, K Shanthi Latha, Nagendar Yamsani, R. Pavithra, P. Rajesh
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Using graph-based machine learning methods turns out to be an effective solution for predicting complex network data. Traditional machine learning techniques lack the capability to handle data structure interrelationships making them produce insufficient prediction results. The research analyzes graph-based machine learning techniques for enhancing predictive outcomes of complex network predictive tasks. Specially designed graph neural networks (GNNS) together with network-based features help extract significant patterns from vast amounts of network data. Our model reaches X% better prediction accuracy according to benchmark tests as compared to typical machine learning methods which operate on the dataset. The model demonstrated substantial robustness improvements based on the evaluation metrics that incorporated accuracy, precision, recall and F1-score. The conducted research indicates the ability of graph-based methods to be applicable in real-world scenarios that include social network investigations and fraud prevention systems while assisting with biological network interpretations. The findings from this study offer crucial knowledge about graph-based ML methods which enables better predictive models in challenging networked systems.

title: A Machine Learning-Enhanced Management Information System for Predictive Human Resource Management
authors: Urmi Haldar, Md Mohibur Rahman, Mohammad Hasibul Hasan, Latul Hasan, Md Anamul Islam, Md Abutaher Dewan
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: The increasing capability of workforce management and the increase of corporate HRM reveal a need for intelligent decision-support tools in HRM. Structured MIS offers little in the way of prediction and more time pressure to be proactive. SOM/IRSPP-2018-0033Paper07 Machine Learning-Enhanced Management Information System for Predictive Human Resource Management. The solution uses machine learning algorithms to forecast employee turnover using a dataset of 311 employee records and 36 demographic, employment, and performance-related characteristics. To discover a sweet spot between interpretability and predictive strength, this research employed Logistic Regression and Random Forest. Logistic Regression was utilized as a baseline for evaluating significant aspects driving attrition, but Random Forest exhibited good prediction performance and provided a significance rating of each feature. Using a dashboard, the following suggested MIS architecture might allow an HR manager to monitor the results of the forecasts mentioned above to make informed strategic choices, such as planning for retention, performance assessment, workforce optimization, etc. The accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, and ROC-AUC were utilized for the model assessment to ensure the system is stable and effective in forecasting the star attrition risk. Machine Learning will make MIS more powerful while boosting HRM by making HRM proactive & data-driven, which will eventually help firms make better choices & enhance employee retention.

title: A New Continually Growing Recursive Lean Instant Slope Constant Estimator for Online Measurement of Derivative and Actual Value of Oversampled Signals
authors: Jonathan Sattler, Benjamin Bachowsky, Benedikt Schmitz-Rode, Marc Hiller, Andreas Liske
publish: 2025 IEEE 10th Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
abstract: This paper introduces a novel, recursive finite impulse response filter with continually growing regression window length. The algorithm implements an adaptive linear Least Squares (LS) regression and optimally computes the slope and actual value in real time at the sampled data rate within a finite set of samples. This can be effectively used in various domains of power electronics such as online parameter identification and predictive control methods. The growing window length allows for highest noise attenuation and highly dynamic runtime characteristics at the same time which is especially useful for measuring switching-state-dependent quantities. Due to the recursive structure, even very large sample windows can be implemented with insignificantly increased hardware demand while maintaining very low latency. Efficient hardware realization on a Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) with fixed-point arithmetics is presented and actual measurement data proves the outstanding performance. Finally, computational effort is benchmarked against non-recursive and fixed-window implementations.

title: Real-Time Water Leak Detection and Management using AI-based Sensor Data Analysis
authors: Medepalli Pushpa, K.Santhi Sri
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Water leakage in distribution systems leads to significant resource loss, infrastructure damage, and increased operational costs. Traditional leak detection methods often suffer from low accuracy, delayed response times, and limited adaptability. This paper proposes an AI-based water leak detection and management system that leverages sensor integration and machine learning techniques for real-time monitoring and accurate leak identification. The system utilizes flow and pressure sensor data combined with a Random Forest classifier to detect abnormal patterns indicative of leaks. Experimental results demonstrate high detection accuracy of 96.3% with a low latency of 1.2 seconds, outperforming conventional threshold-based and acoustic analysis methods. The proposed framework offers an efficient and scalable solution for smart water infrastructure, contributing to sustainable resource management and early leak prevention.

title: Optimization of Ripple Carry Adder using Quantum Computing
authors: N.Parvatham, Rithiga R, Ruzmina M, Arthi Archisha S
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: This paper presents the design, optimization, and simulation of arithmetic circuits using reversible logic for quantum computing applications. The motivation behind this work is to achieve resource-efficient computation through reduced quantum cost, minimized garbage outputs, and lower ancilla requirements. The methodology involves implementing Half Adders, Full Adders, Multiplexers, and Ripple Carry Adders (RCAs) using Toffoli and Peres gates. The proposed 8-bit RCA achieves a quantum cost of 58 using 24 qubits, 8 garbage outputs, and 6 ancilla inputs—showing a significant improvement over conventional Toffoli-based designs that require higher quantum cost and resources. Simulations were conducted on IBM Qiskit and Google Colab using the Qiskit SDK to validate circuit correctness and scalability. The obtained results demonstrate superior resource efficiency and confirm the feasibility of reversible-logic-based quantum arithmetic as a foundation for scalable quantum arithmetic logic units (ALUs) and processors.

title: GDSTGCN-TCN and GDSTGCN-LSTM: A Comparative Study of Dynamic Generalized Spatio-Temporal GCNs with Temporal Modules for Urban Traffic Forecasting
authors: Jai Ganesh K, Kousik B, R M Shiny
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Accurate and reliable short-term traffic forecasting is critical for modern intelligent transportation systems. This paper introduces a novel hybrid architecture, GDSTGCN, which leverages a dynamic graph constructor and spatio-temporal graph convolutions, and presents a rigorous comparative study of two temporal processing modules: Temporal Convolutional Networks (TCN) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks. The framework dynamically builds generalized adjacency matrices from input sequences and utilizes Chebyshev spectral graph convolutions to capture complex spatio-temporal dependencies. Both model variants were evaluated on the widely-used METR-LA benchmark dataset for a 60-minute forecast horizon. The results demonstrate the superiority of the convolutional approach, with the GDSTGCN-TCN model achieving a highly competitive Mean Absolute Error (MAE) of 3.48 and a Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE) of 9.8%. This performance surpassed the LSTM variant and validates the efficacy of combining dynamic graph structures with specialized temporal modules for robust traffic forecasting.

title: Intelligent Theft Detection: A Hybrid Deep Learning System for Supermarket Security
authors: Y. Asina Begum, A. Ajeeth, Mohamed Rafik A, Esai Priya S, R Mohana Prasanth, Sridhar S S
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Shoplifting in retail is a pervasive problem that not only incurs high economic losses but is also a security threat. Conventional surveillance systems are highly reliant on human monitoring, which is highly inefficient considering the high volume of video streaming produced. The problem demands automated intelligent shoplifting detection systems. In this paper, we introduce the challenge of developing a deep learning-based system based on Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) that analyzes a video stream in real-time and detects and identifies behavioral abnormality. The system seeks to detect abnormal behavior, i.e., theft, without continuous human monitoring. The system employed is a pre-trained network that has been trained on a labeled image and video stream database, enabling the network to learn to distinguish between normal and abnormal customer behavior. On the basis of this model, the system will continuously monitor designated areas within the store and, based on the analysis performed on the video stream, automatically raise an alarm to the control room if any suspicious behavior similar to theft is observed within the monitored area. The system's capabilities include continuous surveillance, reduction of the number of operators needed, improvement in detection accuracy, and adaptability to operate in varied retail environments. These attributes are intended to improve the efficiency and management of security in retail stores.

title: Intelligent Document Query System using Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
authors: Rosario Gilmary, B. Pradeepa, N. Manvizhi, D. Nivedha
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: The RAG Chatbot can be considered an AI document-interactive system that integrates Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) technology, thus allowing the owner to interact with their archival documents. It uses Streamlit for its user interface with the backend employing Ollama for the local running of the Large Language Model (LLM) and FAISS for fast vector-based similarity search. The users can upload their documents in formats such as PDF, DOCX, and TXT which are then directly subjected to the text extraction, chunking, and embedding generation process. The embeddings that are produced are indexed by FAISS which allows the chatbot to retrieve the document parts relevant to its answer. The system architecture assures that the response generated by the LLM is always tied to the user's document improving precision and enabling the customer to identify the information source. Besides, the chatbot has features such as document management in real-time, debug mode for response tracing, and local data persistence that not only augment its functionalities but also guarantee privacy. This project illustrates a complete end-to-end realization of a local RAG pipeline integrating language comprehension, retrieval speed, and user engagement in a seamless conversational interface.

title: Thermally-Informed Neural Networks for Junction Temperature Estimation in SiC-Based Automotive Three-Phase Inverters
authors: Diego Kuderna Melgar, Shourya Shukla, Jeremy Nuzzo, Oleksandr Solomakha, Dominik Koch, Ingmar Kallfass
publish: 2025 IEEE 10th Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
abstract: Determining the junction temperature T<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">j</inf> of SiCMOSFETs is of great importance to ensure safe operation in automobiles. State-of-the-art MOSFET thermometry includes methods like lookup tables with insufficient accuracy and computational efficiency. However, thermal neural networks offer a promising solution to the limitations of traditional methods by enabling accurate temperature modeling. This paper presents a thermal neural network approach for automotive threephase inverters, utilizing purely control variables such as the phase currents and DC-link voltage instead of the conventional methods of direct temperature sensing or indirect temperaturesensitive electrical parameter acquisition. It achieves precise temperature estimations with a mean absolute error of 2.09 K, which is in line with the accuracy of the conventional methods and outperforms a lookup table that yields an average absolute error of 5.67 K.

title: Evaluation of Reconstruction Fidelity and Processing Speed in Compression of Prostate Cancer Images using Deep Learning
authors: Rajalingam Arumuganainar, J.R. Arunkumar, R.Anusuya, K.P.Kamini
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: This study examines how two advanced CNN designs, NASNetMobile and EfficientNetB4, perform photo compression tasks. The emphasis is on how well the computer functions, reconstructs objects, and compresses data. When the same parameters and natural picture datasets were used for training and testing, both models achieved a constant compression ratio (CR) of 150.53. We evaluated performance using quantitative criteria such as peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR), root mean square error (RMSE), and encoding/decoding timings. EfficientNetB4 had a PSNR of 32.11 dB and an RMSE of 6.32, but NASNetMobile had a PSNR of 34.99 dB and an RMSE of 4.54, indicating that it was better at reconstructing images. EfficientNetB4 encoded faster than NASNetMobile (0.239 s vs. 1.382 s), but both models decoded almost immediately. When it comes to high-quality rebuilding, NASNetMobile is a clear winner. When speed is critical, EfficientNetB4 is the clear choice. When bandwidth is restricted or latency is an issue, such as in real-time transmission, remote sensing, and mobile imaging, it is critical to strike a balance between speed and accuracy. The results are quite useful in determining which deep learning models to use in these scenarios. This research helps us better understand convolutional neural network (CNN) compression frameworks and how to improve their performance for real-world applications.

title: Data-Driven LSTM Framework for Robust SoC Prediction in Battery Applications
authors: Alagar Karthick, Maddur Pedda Chennaiah, S. Kaliappan, V. Jayashree
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Battery-powered systems to function safely and efficiently, particularly in renewable energy storage and electric vehicles (EVs), precise State of Charge (SoC), calculation is essential. To accurately forecast SoC, this research suggests a data-driven method based on Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks. By training on data collected in real-time, the LSTM model can capture the nonlinear patterns and intricate temporal correlations that are intrinsic to a battery's charge-discharge cycles. When compared to more traditional machine learning approaches, the LSTM model achieves better outcomes in terms of stability of predictions, root mean square error (RMSE), and Mean Absolute Error (MAE). Because of its strong generalizability under different load conditions, the suggested method is well-suited for incorporation into state-of-the-art Battery Management Information Systems (BMS). In smart mobility and storage for energy applications, this work helps to improve the lifespan of batteries, safety, and optimize energy use.

title: Advanced AI Models for Renewable Energy Integration in Power Distribution Networks
authors: Konda Raju, Merugu Ranjith, R. Durga Rao, P.Tirupathi
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Multiple issues arise in power distribution networks when integrating renewable energy systems since solar and wind power operate erratically. The conventional power grid performs inadequately when integrating renewable power because of stability and operational efficiency problems. The authors propose implementing advanced AI models for enhancing the integration process of renewable energy sources into power distribution networks. The prediction of energy demand and grid distribution optimization and energy storage enhancements offer deep learning together with reinforcement learning models as solution implementation. We implemented our method on simulated grid data and obtained higher power grid stability by 15% accompanied by 20% decreased energy waste levels against standard procedures. The analysis verifies AI-based technological solutions as effective tools for managing complex renewable energy integration problems to establish renewable power systems with better reliability and sustainability. I conclude that AI models hold a lot of promise in enhancing the performance of power grids that are highly renewable energy penetrated, and future work will examine these models for future real time applications.

title: Federated Learning and its Uses in Modern Medical Industry: Concepts and Challenges
authors: Sivashankar G, Satvik Sawhney, Ishita Goel, Ashokkumar P, Vandhana S, K.Babu
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Sensitive medical data has increased in the modern world due to the growing use of smart devices and linked healthcare systems. This development has made privacy and security more complicated, which has enormous potential for creating accurate and reliable statistical models. One possible approach to achieve this is by utilising data-driven technology, commonly known as Machine Learning (ML). However, the effectiveness of Machine Learning in fully capitalising on existing medical data is limited. Machine Learning is confined within data silos and access to it is restricted because of privacy concerns. ML is limited in its capabilities and can’t reach its full potential. Furthermore, it will not be able to transition from a research phase to clinical practice unless it’s given sufficient access to data. Traditional machine learning and deep learning approaches in medical AI often require centralised data, storage and communication. Federated learning (FL) promises a solution to these complications. It provides a decentralised method for training AI models without exchanging patient data. This paper explores the advantaged and disadvantages of the use of federated learning in the medical field. The results shows that the proposed method is 12.5% increase in accuracy than the existing methods.

title: MAViT: A Hybrid Adversarial Vision Transformer for Secure and Robust Threat Detection in IoT-based Medical Systems
authors: Sangeetha Moligi, Ramesh Dadi, Vani Vathsala Atluri
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Medical Internet of Things (IoT) and connected imaging systems are a major contributor to the improved healthcare delivery. Nevertheless, the transformation still leaves significant cybersecurity issues that the likes of patient privacy, data integrity, and clinical decision-making might be jeopardized. Most of the traditional machine learning alongside simpler deep learning models struggle to handle high dimensionality, complexity, and adversarial nature of the network traffic. These limitations are the main reasons for the existence of the need for more powerful, tougher, and adaptable security solutions. Hence. this work aims at addressing the issues with MAViT (Medical Adversarial Vision Transformer), a novel combination of a hybrid transformer-based framework for cyber threat detection and classification. The core concept of MAViT is to employ MedViT which depicts the global behavioral patterns of IoT devices together with AdvTrans that locates the minimum and adversarial traffic anomalies. According to the experiment, MAViT was found to be better than eight other deep learning models of the latest development, with the following effectiveness: accuracy of 99.2%, precision of 99.0%, recall of 99.3%, F1-score of 99.1%, and a very low error rate of 0.8% in comparison with baseline accuracies of 91.8–93.2% and error rates of 6.8–8.2%.

title: Spatio-Graphical Vision Transformer Framework for fMRI-based Autism Spectrum Disorder Diagnosis
authors: Venkata Ratna Prabha K, Chinni Hima Bindu, K Rama Devi
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Autism spectrum disorder(ASD) pose a great challenge to diagnosis due to its complex neurological characteristics and minimal changes in brain imaging. Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) has potential insights, but the high dimensionality of the data creates significant challenges for the analysis. Early and accurate detection of ASD promotes for an effective intervention, which serves as a motivating factor for the exploring models that capture not only spatial but also relational neural patterns. In this aspect, this paper proposes a novel ASD classification methodology utilizing multiple 2D slices extracted from fMRI scans, aiming to reduce the effects caused by high dimensionality in the data. This framework incorporates a spatial transformer network(STN) to enhance alignment, a vision transformer(ViT) to extract spatial and contextual features, and a graph convolutional network(GCN) to model topological relationships between brains. This hybrid design integrates attention and graph-based learning, presenting a technically significant development in the direction of more interpretable neuroimaging analysis. The experimental results prove that this design outperforms traditional deep learning models, achieving a classification accuracy of 94.07% under 5-fold cross-validation. These results show the superiority of combining attention and graph-based approaches to improve the accuracy and reliability of ASD diagnosis from neuroimaging data.

title: Speech Enhancement using U-Net-based TF-Locoformer with Multi-Dilated Dense Blocks
authors: Hanna Deepa Mallolu, Sunny Dayal Vanambathina
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Real-time speech enhancement in noisy environments poses a significant technical challenge, particularly with the increasing demand for seamless communication through devices such as voice assistants and hearing aids. This paper introduces a real-time speech enhancement framework built upon a fully convolutional encoder-decoder U-Net architecture, enhanced with skip connections, causal and dilated convolutions. The TF-Locoformer, a Transformer-based model that uses traditional FFNs with convolutional ones to enhance local modeling, while self-attention captures global context. Two convolutional FFNs surround the attention block, and a new normalization layer is proposed for TF-domain dual-path models. In contrast, Causal convolutions ensure real-time processing, while dilated layers capture multi-scale context. The Densely connected Multi-Dilated dense block(D3) acts as the central layer in the U-Net, leveraging dilated convolutions and dense connections to grasp wider contextual information while retaining fine details. The proposed approach achieves a computationally efficient framework suitable for real-time deployment, demonstrating a significant advance in speech enhancement technology. Experiments show superior Short-Time Objective Intelligibility (STOI) and Perceptual Evaluation of Speech Quality (PESQ) compared to existing real-time systems and achieve state-of-the-art (SOTA) performance across multiple benchmarks without relying on RNNs.

title: A Thorough Review of the JScript Technology to Perform Client-side Code Execution Attacks
authors: Jean Rosemond Dora, Ladislav Hluchy, Friday Ikechukwu Agu
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: The DotNetToJScript (DTJS) project, released in 2017, established an impressive technique for reflectively loading .NET shellcode using Windows scripting languages like JScript and VBScript. While this approach enables powerful exploitation, initial implementations using standard C# assemblies and Win32 API calls are now highly susceptible to modern antivirus (AV) detection. This paper addresses the gap by providing an in-depth methodology to enhance the stealth and effectiveness of this injection technique. We bypass the limitations of web browser attacks by focusing on the Windows Script Host (WSH) environment, leveraging it as a robust execution vector. Our technical significance lies in the comprehensive analysis of JScript’s role within the DotNetToJScript framework, combined with a novel AV bypass technique that alters the generated assembly to evade static and behavioral analysis. We demonstrate how the traditional assembly structure leads to detection and introduce specific modifications that enable the successful and stealthy execution of a reverse shell payload. This work serves as a substantial examination of modern application whitelisting and code-level evasion techniques against endpoint security.

title: A Comprehensive Review of Bias and Fairness in Artificial Intelligence for Oral Cancer Detection
authors: Rohan R Gadgimata, Sadgyan J Jaiswal, Nikita
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Oral cancer is a major health issue all over the world, and the early diagnosis of the same will be important in enhancing the chances of survival of the patient. Deep learning based Artificial Intelligence (AI) models have demonstrated high potential in the ability to accurately identify oral cancer using medical images. However, the major problem of these technologies is that they have the ability to learn and even exaggerate the existing prejudices based on the data they are trained on. This will result in less accurate AI tools among some groups of individuals, which will exacerbate healthcare inequities rather than resolve them. The present review of the literature presents the current application of AI to detect oral cancer, particularly focusing on the issue of bias and fairness. We consider the origin of bias, e.g., unbalanced datasets, which are not diverse and ways of quantifying fairness in these AI systems. Our overview reveals that AI has the potential to increase the disparity in health equity among various regions of the globe without proper planning to make it equitable. We conclude by offering recommendations on the way forward, such as forming more inclusive data sets, and encouraging research teams in order to ensure AI in healthcare is produced ethically and equally benefiting all people.

title: Deep Learning-based Image Analysis in Skin Cancer: A Review of Methods and Trends
authors: M.Malathi, F.Mary Harin Fernandez
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Skin cancer diagnosis continues to be a critical challenge, as conventional visual inspection often lacks the sensitivity required to detect subtle and early-stage abnormalities. Recent advances in computer-aided diagnosis have introduced automated image recognition systems capable of analyzing dermoscopic images with higher accuracy and consistency. Convolutional Neural Networks have become the most powerful deep learning architecture, providing strong feature extraction capabilities and highly accurate classification of benign and malignant lesions. In addition to CNN-based methods, traditional machine learning algorithms trained on diverse datasets have shown strong generalization across varying patient populations. Transfer learning has greatly advanced the field by allowing pre-trained models to be adapted for skin cancer classification, minimizing computational demands and the need for large training datasets. Preprocessing techniques such as normalization, hair artifact removal, denoising, and contrast enhancement play a vital role in refining image quality and improving diagnostic performance. Collectively, these computational techniques are reshaping the landscape of skin cancer detection, supporting earlier diagnosis, reducing diagnostic errors, and enhancing patient outcomes.

title: NearLink Layer 2 Protocol Adaptation Solution for Industrial Wireless Control
authors: Junfei Gu, Zhenyu Ju, Bin Wu, Rui Wang, Zhangqi Zhu
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Wireless Communication, Networking and Internet of Things (WCNIoT)
abstract: This paper addresses compatibility issues between NearLink wireless communication technology and industrial Ethernet protocols by proposing a software-defined adaptation solution. Leveraging topology virtualization and address mapping modules, this approach achieves Layer 2 protocol conversion without modifying native protocols. Tests conducted in automotive manufacturing welding workshops demonstrate that within a range of 20 to 120 meters and with data frame lengths ranging from 32 to 128 bytes, this solution consistently ensures deterministic and highly reliable communication. Period jitters are stably controlled within 650 μs, with 99.9% of tail delays falling below the communication cycle. Furthermore, packet loss rates remain at zero in the vast majority of test scenarios.

title: An image information encryption method for power scenarios based on optical transmission equipment
authors: Gang Qu, Ye Liang, Liang Zhang, Erbo Shang, Haochun Jin, Jieyin Bai
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Wireless Communication, Networking and Internet of Things (WCNIoT)
abstract: With the rapid development of smart grids and digital substations. Inspection robots, video surveillance, and unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) inspections in power scenarios have generated a large amount of image data containing key information. These data are at risk of leakage and tampering when transmitted through the power communication network. To ensure its confidentiality and integrity, this paper proposes an image encryption method based on an optical chaotic system and optical transformation theory for secure image transmission in optical devices. The encryption process begins with Fresnel diffraction transformation of the original image to obtain amplitude-phase values, which are used for key generation. Subsequently, a chaotic phase mask generated by the optical chaotic system, combined with a random phase mask and Fresnel diffraction principles, it is used to encrypt the image information. Through simulation and a thorough security analysis, we demonstrate that the proposed algorithm can effectively resists statistical analysis attacks. This research provides an efficient and secure solution for the safe transmission of power scene images in optical communication systems.

title: High Performance Multimodal MRI and CT Scan-based Deep Learning Model for Brain Tumor Identification
authors: Jona. J. B, D. Kalpanadevi, Kartheeban K, Jeevitha S, Sri Ram Ganesh M, Somasundaram R S
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Accurate and fast diagnosis of tumors in the brain continues to be difficult in medical images, considering the difficult anatomies and classic diagnosis shortcomings. We, in this paper, propose a robust multimodal deep learning framework, based on trusted data (both MRI and CT), and, moreover, automatic classification of brain tumors. We managed to create this framework, taking advantage of an openly available data set of 9,618 labeled MRI and CT images and brain tumors. The four classes of consideration were: Healthy (MRI/CT) and Tumor (MRI/CT). Constructed upon the respective strengths of MRIs and of CTs, enabling trusted diagnosis, a hybrid structure was developed, founded on the basis of MobileNet V3, and enriched by the inclusion of additional custom convolution layers so as so extract high-level features and learn spatial information. Various state-of-art training schemes were incorporated, including real-time data augmentation and use of the AdamW optimizer, aiding generalizability of the model and overfitting prevention. Performance of each method was evaluated on the basis of baseline architectures: ResNet50, DenseNet121, CNN-BiLSTM, and we deduced that optimized MobileNetV3+CNN is superior over all tested approaches. It achieves the highest and best level of accuracy of 99%. Moreover, the model incorporates a light-howitz structure, enabling it, thus, to be efficient and deployable as an edge model in real-time diagnosis approaches. Our work here has verified the hypothesis that, provided we use light but informative neural architectures, and optimized training approaches, we will extract superior levels of classification accuracy and strongly scalable methods in work of analysis of medical images. Future work will involve cross domain validation and explainable AI modules so aid clinical decision support and trust. The research shows the possibility of deep learning application in neuro-oncology or any medical imaging facing similar challenges with the given research question, and the possibility of similar applications in industrial images.

title: Prescriptive Analytics for Dynamic Pricing and Automated Load Balancing in a Decentralized Smart Grid
authors: Ravuri Lalitha, Ayush Kumar, Shaik Salma Samreen, Syed Khadar Basha, Musalamadugu Vyshnavi
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: As the use of electricity grows and more renewable energy sources like solar and wind are added; it becomes harder to manage energy in smart grids. Traditional systems often cannot keep up with changes, which leads to poor predictions, missed faults, and trouble in handling large amounts of data. To solve these problems, this paper presents a smart system that uses big data and artificial intelligence to better manage electricity. It uses deep learning models to predict how much electricity will be needed, detect faults early, and automatically balance the load in the grid. The system also uses dynamic pricing, which means changing the price of electricity based on the time of day to reduce peak demand and save energy. In tests, the system predicted electricity use with 96.1% accuracy, balanced loads with 93.5% efficiency, and detected faults with 94.2% accuracy. It also helped reduce the highest electricity use by 12.3%. This new method is better than older systems, helps save energy, lowers costs, and can grow with future needs.

title: Automated Multi-Stage Deep Learning Framework for Product Image Enhancement in E-Commerce Applications
authors: Inba Yazhini F S, Adlin Vinusha W, Madhumitha R
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: High-quality product imagery is crucial to increasing customer engagement and driving sales on e-commerce platforms. However, this often results in lower user satisfaction and a reduced conversion rate due to manual editing of images and inconsistent qualities. This work proposes an automated image enhancement framework that leverages deep learning combined with computer vision to provide effective product visualization. The proposed system employs instance segmentation for isolating objects; a DBN combined with DQN for optimizing segmentation and automating background replacement; an LSTM network for maintaining contextual coherence in sequential image data; and ESRGAN to generate visually appealing, high-resolution outputs. The framework is implemented using MATLAB and reduces the training, testing, and evaluation tasks. The novelty is indeed the multistage integration of deep learning architectures that allowed a fully automated, high-fidelity product image enhancement pipeline with complete elimination of human intervention to enhance customer trust, engagement, and purchase likelihood.

title: Revisit Fast Event Matching-Routing for High Volume Subscriptions
authors: Qichen Luo, Zhiyun Zhou, Ruisheng Shi, Lina Lan, Qingling Feng, Qifeng Luo, Di Ao
publish: IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management
abstract: Although many scalable event matching algorithms have been proposed to achieve scalability for publish/subscribe services, the content-based pub/sub system still suffer from performance deterioration when the system has large numbers of subscriptions, and cannot support the requirements of real-time pub/sub data services. In this paper, we model the event matching problem as an existence problem which only care about whether there is at least one matching subscription in the given subscription set, differing from existing works that try to speed up the time-consuming search operation to find all matching subscriptions. To solve this existence problem efficiently, we propose DLS (Discrete Label Set), a novel subscription and event representation model. Based on the DLS model, we propose an event matching algorithm with O(Nd) time complexity to support real-time event matching for a large volume of subscriptions and high event arrival speed, where Nd is the node degree in overlay network. Experimental results show that the event matching performance can be improved by several orders of magnitude compared with traditional algorithms.

title: Edge Server Load Balancing using Steerable Free Space Optics for Partial Mesh Optical Access Networks
authors: Atri Mukhopadhyay, Marco Ruffini
publish: IEEE Transactions on Communications
abstract: Edge computing provides crucial support to next-generation mobile services that demand high data rates, low latency, and high reliability. The development of high data rate communication has lead to the emergence of cell densification as a key enabler for 5G. Unfortunately, the cost of fiber for backhaul and fronthaul poses hindrance to wide-scale adoption of small cells. Free Space Optics (FSO) offers a cost-effective alternative, though its performance is vulnerable to adverse weather, particularly fog. Recent advances in adaptive optics and automatic steering/tracking have improved FSO reliability by reducing pointing errors and enabling dynamic link reconfiguration, which further supports intelligent traffic diversion and load balancing across edge servers. In this paper, we propose a multi-hop mesh optical access network that integrates fiber-based Passive Optical Networks (PONs) with steerable FSO links to provide reliable and scalable backhaul for dense Radio Access Networks (RANs). A joint optimization framework for dynamic routing and edge server load balancing is developed. Extensive simulations demonstrate that the proposed design ensures fairness, reduces the number of required FSO transceivers, and delivers data rates comparable to established benchmarks.

title: Distributed Large-Signal Stability Analysis and Stabilization for DC Microgrid Clusters
authors: Sucheng Liu, Li Luan, Jinyu Ning, Wei Fang, Qianjin Zhang, Xiaodong Liu
publish: IEEE Transactions on Smart Grid
abstract: DC microgrid clusters (DCMGCs) enhance resilience and efficiency but face significant large-signal stability challenges due to growing integration of distributed energy sources and power electronics, exacerbated by inter-subgrid couplings that remain poorly understood. This work proposes a novel distributed approach for large-signal stability analysis and stabilization of DCMGCs. The core methodology focuses on individual DC microgrids and their coupling interactions. With the decomposition-aggregation fashion, scalar Lyapunov functions are employed to derive distributed stability criteria, and two metrics (stability strength and connectivity strength) and the associated decoupling ratio are introduced to explicitly quantify the impact of coupling dynamics on system stability. Based on the identified relationships between power flow control coefficients and system stability, key parameters are optimally designed to ensure system-wide stable operation. Compared to centralized methods requiring global states, this approach reduces modeling complexity, enhances scalability, and lowers conservatism. The effectiveness of the proposed approach is validated through numerical and hardware-in-the-loop experiments.

title: Privacy-Preserving Predefined-Time Secondary Control for Networked Microgrid With CPLs: An Auxiliary Variable Encryption Approach
authors: Xuan Ye, Jinhui Wu, Fanghong Guo, Lei Wang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Industrial Electronics
abstract: As networked microgrids (NMGs) expand in scale, they face growing challenges in privacy security and control performance, including demands for enhanced dynamic response, accuracy, and robustness. This is particularly critical in the DC NMG with high-penetration constant power loads (CPLs), as their negative impedance characteristics can trigger oscillations and instability. To address these issues, this study proposes a privacy-preserving predefined-time secondary control strategy by integrating auxiliary variable-based data encryption with a CPL stability compensation mechanism. An active damping mechanism based on decoupled voltage feedback is proposed to suppress CPL-induced instability with rigorous stability conditions. OPAL-RT experiments are set up to demonstrate the strategy’s effectiveness in privacy protection, fast convergence, low steady-state error, and CPL tolerance level.

title: WCNIoT 2025 Content Announcement Page
authors: N/A
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Wireless Communication, Networking and Internet of Things (WCNIoT)

title: Performance, Evaluation and Optimization of an Open-Source Datalogger for High-Mountain Environmental Monitoring
authors: J. Pol Lujan, Robert Alvarado, Luzmila Davila, Jhean Aguilar, Luis Torres, Pablo Iribarren
publish: IEEE Sensors Journal
abstract: The limited availability of meteorological data in high mountain regions has driven the development of technological solutions tailored for environments lacking conventional network coverage. This study presents the design and evaluation of Datalogger ”Two” or ”II”, an embedded solution aimed at glacierised basins in Peru. This new version improves on the previous designs (Datalogger ”I” or ”One” and Datalogger ”Zero”) by applying a continuous improvement methodology based on lessons learned during field deployment. Key upgrades include the integration of INA219 modules for high-precision analog measurement and a DS3231 real-time clock with battery backup to ensure time synchronization during power outages. Physical interfaces (terminal blocks and micro SD slot) were also redesigned to simplify field maintenance and usability. The system was tested in both laboratory tests and real-world validation in the Palcacocha moraine, 4,595 m above sea level(m a.s.l) and the Llaca glacier, 4,647 m a.s.l., demonstrating stable operation between -2 °C and 12 °C, with relative humidity between 4% and 100%. A comparative analysis of 26 similar technological developments was performed, classifying their data acquisition systems into three levels: modular, semi-modular, and embedded. The Datalogger II, categorized as an embedded system, stands out by combining the flexibility and low cost of academic designs with the robustness of commercial grade solutions. Its architecture positions it as a viable platform for hydrometeorological monitoring networks, scientific research in extreme environments, and educational programs that require reliable and scalable instrumentation.

title: Stabilization of stochastic complex network switched systems under event-triggered switching controls
authors: Xuetao Yanga, Anjie Li, Quanxin Zhub
publish: IEEE Transactions on Automation Science and Engineering
abstract: This paper investigates the exponential stabilization of stochastic complex network switched systems (SCNSSs) with a novel event-triggered switching control, which comprises a primary control and a secondary control. In this control, “switching” has two implications. One is consistent with the switching signal of the system and the other refers to the switching between the primary control and the secondary control. Moreover, unlike traditional systems that utilize a single event-triggering mechanism (ETM), this paper introduces multiple ETMs to improve the control strategy by determining the updating instants of the primary control and the switching instants between the primary and secondary controls. Under the proposed novel event-triggered switching control, the asynchronous problem of time series is solved and the mean-square exponential stabilization for SCNSSs is obtained. Finally, the effectiveness of theoretical results is demonstrated through the simulation conducted on a stochastic oscillator system with multiple nodes.

title: Image-Based Dual Defense Strategy for Adversarially Robust IDS in Smart Agriculture
authors: Rafika Saadouni, Chirihane Gherbi, Zibouda Aliouat, Yasmine Harbi, Amina Khacha, Hakim Mabed
publish: IEEE Internet of Things Journal
abstract: The integration of Internet of Things (IoT) technologies into smart agriculture has significantly enhanced automation, monitoring, and productivity. However, these systems introduce critical cybersecurity vulnerabilities and generate heterogeneous data, including structured network traffic and image-based inputs. This requires an intrusion detection system (IDS) capable of handling multimodal data, particularly since adversarial attacks can manipulate inputs to evade traditional detection models. To address these challenges, this paper proposes a novel image-based IDS for smart agriculture environments. The system transforms network traffic into images and employs VGG16 for feature extraction, Binary Greylag Goose Optimization for feature selection, and a random forest for classification. It further integrates a dual defense strategy that combines a Convolutional Autoencoder Denoising (CAED) module with Adversarial Training (AT) to improve robustness against adversarial perturbations. The proposed solution is evaluated on the CICIoT2023 dataset in eight traffic classes under three white-box adversarial attacks. The IDS demonstrates strong resilience across all perturbation levels. For weak perturbations (ε=0.01), the dual defense achieves accuracies of at least 99.46%. Under moderate perturbations (ε=0.1), it maintains high performance with macro-averaged accuracies of at least 99.39%. Even under strong perturbations (ε=0.3), the system remains robust, attaining an accuracy of at least 96.50%. To assess generalization to real agricultural settings, the IDS is also tested using native crop images from the agricultural dataset. Under severe adversarial distortion (ε=0.3), the system maintains robustness, achieving a macro-averaged accuracy of at least 96.71%. These results confirm that the proposed multimodal IDS provides a resilient, adaptive security solution for smart agriculture networks facing advanced adversarial threats.

title: Few-Shot Network Thinning: A Unified Dense Compression Framework for CNNs and ViTs
authors: Xin Huang, Longhua Li, Lei Qi, Xin Geng
publish: IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing
abstract: As data privacy concerns become increasingly critical, achieving efficient model compression under limited training data and resource-constrained edge devices has become a major challenge. Traditional few-shot network compression methods struggle to strike a balance between effective model compression and maintaining dense representation capacity. To address this, we propose a unified dense compression framework for both CNNs and ViTs named UniDC, integrating two key components: module selection strategy and progressive compression. Specifically, we design a balanced module screening mechanism to prevent excessive compression of critical spatial operations. Furthermore, we introduce a clustering-based parameter compression method, which adaptively aggregates similar weights into representative centers through layer-wise clustering, enabling efficient dense compression while preserving representational power. Extensive experiments on ImageNet demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach. Notably, our method achieves a mere 1.1% accuracy drop for ViT-B/16 while reducing latency by 17.1% using only 1,000 training samples, outperforming existing methods across both CNN and ViT architectures.

title: Analysis of Blockchain-Integrated Access Control Models in Distributed Cloud Environments
authors: Kamala Kamatchi G, Vanitha K
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: widespread adoption of decentralized cloud applications has driven the requirement for secure, scalable, and auditable access control methods. Existing centralised methods, such as role-based, attribute-based, and required access control, suffer from a single point of failure, a lack of disclosure, and difficulties enforcing cross-language, cross-country policies. Blockchain has emerged as a breakthrough in overcoming these limitations by creating hand-in-hand decentralization and immutability, combined with programmable trust (smart contracts, decentralized identities). This paper addresses the basics of cloud access control and blockchain, along with the evolution of their integration in various fields, including healthcare, IoT, financial systems, smart grids, and cloud storage. An organized technique inspired by the systematic literature review principles is applied to review selected proposals, cluster access control models, and compare their performance with the classical models. Transparency, accountability, and automation of authorization are also validated, together with practical uses that illustrate that, in the context of compliance and resiliency, blockchain is of paramount importance. Open challenges, including scalability, privacy, interoperability, and regulatory issues, are analyzed in the review, as well as promising research directions such as lightweight consensus, cross-chain interoperability, and AI-blockchain integration. This work presents an overview of blockchain as an essential basis for secure access control for possible distributed cloud systems, incorporating the most recent trends and challenges.

title: Edge Intelligence for Real-Time Image and Audio Processing in IoT Environments
authors: Xuankun Chen
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Wireless Communication, Networking and Internet of Things (WCNIoT)
abstract: This article systematically investigates the key technologies for real-time processing of image and audio data by edge intelligence in the IoT environment and proposes a collaborative processing framework that integrates task scheduling, resource allocation, and stability assurance. By constructing a mathematical model that couples tasks, communication, and computing resources, and combining multi-objective optimization with Lyapunov stability theory, an online decision-making mechanism is designed to achieve a dynamic balance between latency, energy consumption, and recognition accuracy. Experimental results demonstrate that this approach significantly outperforms traditional benchmark methods in both simulation and real-world scenarios, maintaining low latency, low energy consumption, and high accuracy in complex dynamic environments. It demonstrates excellent robustness and adaptability, providing theoretical support and technical pathways for the widespread application of edge intelligence in real-time IoT systems.

title: Waveform Design Optimization for Integrated Sensing and Communication in 6G Networks using Modified OFDM
authors: Gujjula Ramya, Puli Kishore Kumar, Dhatrika Santhosh Kumar
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Integrated Sensing and Communications (ISAC) merges radar sensing and wireless communication within a unified framework to improve spectral and hardware efficiency, a critical goal for future 6G networks. This paper focuses on Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM)-based ISAC systems, which are optimized for high-resolution sensing, accurate positioning, and interference resilience. The motivation lies in addressing the trade-off between sensing accuracy and computational or energy cost, especially in resource-limited environments. To achieve this, three operational modes are explored: Interference Cancellation (IC) for enhanced sensing reliability, Non-IC for low-complexity, energy-efficient operation, and an adaptive switching mechanism that dynamically selects between the two based on real-time system and environmental conditions. Simulation and analytical results demonstrate that the adaptive scheme significantly improves overall system performance by maintaining sensing quality while minimizing power consumption. The proposed framework offers a scalable and intelligent solution for future power-efficient, flexible, and high-speed OFDMbased ISAC systems, ensuring robust performance under varying operational scenarios.

title: Design of a Low-Profile Dual-Band Flexible Omnidirectional Microstrip Antenna with Star-Shaped Slot for WBAN Applications
authors: Naveen Mithul R. K, Rajeswari P, Sudharsan K, Manosivasakthi R, Gobinath A, Anandan M
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: This paper focuses on the design, simulation and performance evaluation of a new flexible compact dual band microstrip patch antenna for Wireless Body Area Network (WBAN) applications. The proposed antenna operates at two different resonant frequencies 2.58 GHz and 5.5 GHz which work in ISM and WLAN bands and is ideally suitable for wearable and biomedical communication applications. The designed antenna is fabricated on an RT/Duroid 5870 substrate having εr = 2.2 which is flexible in nature and provides good mechanical properties. The simulation results show that the return loss is –24.5 dB (at 2.58 GHz) and –12.55 dB (at 5.5 GHz) which ensures good dual band impedance matching and respective VSWR is less than 2 which shows good transmission characteristics. The overall dimension of the designed antenna is small and its gain is measured –6 dB which provides good signal propagation characteristics and is also compared with SAR safety standard which ensures the effectiveness of the designed antenna. The results show that the designed antenna is suitable for use in next generation wearable biomedical applications and IoT based health monitoring systems.

title: Spatiotemporal Deep Learning for Forecasting Regional Sea-Level Rise using Annual Temperature Trends
authors: J.Shanthini, V.Priya, C.S.Madhumathi, L.R.Sujithra, P.Sarvesh
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Predictive skill in forecasting regional rise of sea-level is essential to steer adaptive coastal management, but is currently limited by lack of in situ observations and complex non-linear response between warming of the atmosphere and of the ocean. This paper presents a new deep-learning spatiotemporal modelling of accountable data collected on a year-to-year basis of changes in surface temperatures produced by the International Meridional Fermentation (IMF) database, synthesising on high-resolution coastal topography data and metrics of glaciological observations and providing sub-national assessments of change in sea level. The architecture combines the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) to extract spatial information in the form of geospatial grids with an emphasis on long short-term memory (LSTM) units that capture time evolution of the temperature gradient. A multi-input fusion layer integrates data streams that are heterogeneous, and attention mechanisms highlight areas where the temperature anomalies have the greatest impact on modulating local sea-level variability. The performance is measured on few vulnerable coastal regions in Asia and the Global South, with traditional statistical and physical models involved. The results proved that there was a significant decrease in forecast error (down to 30% mean absolute error) and an increase in interpretability due to attention-based saliency maps. The resulting method would hence offer a harnessable prototype of the feasibility of data-driven estimation of coast hazards and help advance specific climate-adaptation plans.

title: AI based Intrusion Detection for 5G Networks
authors: Rajasekar L, Adityansh Kumar, Rishabh Singh, Pongiannan R K, S. Palanikumar, Pemila M
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: The digital era today mainly depends on Cyber security, because it is one of the fundamental needs of new gen networks. This plays an important role and part in modern communication, cloud-based IoT services and systems. Conventional or previously used (instruction detection system) mainly depends upon pre-defined rules and features manually created this leads to an inefficient system that cannot be adopted against unique and evolving cyber-attacks of new generation. This research paper proposes a highly adaptable intrusion detection system powered with the help of Artificial Intelligence (AI-IDS). This dependable system simultaneously uses machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) this increases and takes the detection ranges from high to low which improves accuracy, adaptiveness and sturdiness. Researched framework processes all network traffic, Memory (LSTM) networks. In the research, all experimental results and data are performed on (NSL-KDD) and cyber-attacks data taken from CICIDS-2017 datasets. The results show a highly appreciable detection accuracy of 97.14% having with a false rate of 3.15% which clearly outperforms all previously used IDS methods. These results show a high potential of AI-IDS in getting recognition for becoming a scalable and real time solution for upcoming cyber threats in new gen network systems.

title: Enhancing Cybersecurity using Deep Learning for Real-Time Threat Detection and Response
authors: Sejal Mishra, Arif Mohamed Khan Rabi Ahamad, Nandhini N, D. Ragunath, Gotte Ranjith Kumar, Barath. S
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: It is essential to guarantee that network security is robust in the swiftly changing cyber threat landscape. This investigation investigates the utilization of deep learning, specifically Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), for the real-time detection and response of cybersecurity threats. The proposed system utilizes the capacity of CNNs to analyze intricate patterns in high-dimensional data, thereby facilitating the precise and rapid identification of anomalies and malicious activities. The CNN model was trained using a preprocessed dataset that included network traffic data and a variety of threat signatures. The model exhibited exceptional accuracy and efficiency in the detection of a wide range of cyber threats, such as unauthorized access, fraud attempts, and malware. An integrated threat response system that was capable of autonomously mitigating identified risks facilitated real-time deployment. The results showed a substantial increase in detection rates and a decrease in false positives when compared to conventional methods. This research highlights the potential of CNNs to improve cybersecurity, thereby enabling the development of proactive, intelligent, and scalable defense mechanisms against emergent cyber threats.

title: Research on the Application of Intelligent Network based Remote Online Monitoring System for New Energy Vehicles
authors: Zheng Wang, Liya Liu, Longyi Ran, Sankun Yao
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Wireless Communication, Networking and Internet of Things (WCNIoT)
abstract: By conducting research and analysis of the online monitoring technology of existing new energy vehicles, in response to the current monitoring methods, such as information delay, inaccurate positioning, and inability to monitor the internal and external states of the car operation in real time, this paper proposes the following new ideas to solve the problem: This paper mainly focuses on the research of the intelligent monitoring system of new energy vehicles under the Internet of Things mode, adopts an intelligent monitoring center, a large number of in-vehicle monitoring devices, and historical databases to establish an intelligent monitoring system in the Internet of Things mode, intelligent analysis, rapid early warning, high-speed processing, and reduce the incidence of accidents. The alarm and early warning speed is within seconds. Use 5G technology as a communication means to increase the real-time and rapidity of information transmission, avoid serious accident consequences caused by information delay, and information reaches within seconds in time. Use repeated positioning methods to improve positioning accuracy. The in-vehicle controller collects data and locates it for the first time, the adjacent vehicle controller collects data and locates it again, and the urban monitoring system assists in positioning; the positioning accuracy is accurate to 1m. Use high-definition and all-round video surveillance to monitor the inside and outside of the car in real time, including road conditions, vehicle conditions, passengers and driver status in the car, etc. Once an abnormality occurs, an efficient early warning device will be triggered. The clarity reaches 720P, and the delay is controlled within seconds.

title: Deep Learning for Robust Audio Fingerprinting to Enhance Music Retrieval and Recognition
authors: Vimaladevi M, Thangamani R, Santhiya S, V.Gopinath, Suganth Krishna E, Sathishkumar Veerappampalayam Easwaramoorthy
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: This project leverages deep learning to create an effective audio fingerprinting system for Tamil songs. Using cutting-edge architectures like Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) and Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN), the system extracts intricate patterns from audio signals, converting them into compact, robust fingerprints for unique song identification. Key components include data preprocessing optimized for Tamil audio, designing and training deep learning models for feature extraction and fingerprint generation, and developing a scalable, efficient fingerprint matching algorithm for real-time application. Objectives include enhancing accuracy, robustness, and scalability, addressing noise resilience, scalability to large databases, and adaptability to varying audio qualities and formats. The anticipated outcome is a state-of-the-art audio fingerprinting system for Tamil music, advancing digital music technologies, content recognition, and copyright management in the Tamil music industry and beyond.

title: Fruit Detection and Yield Estimation using Path Aggregation Feature Pyramid Network and Deep SORT Algorithm: A Case Study on Orange Fruit
authors: Vaishnavi M, Bharaniharan. A, Mohanapriya. S, Thanush. P
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Accurate fruit detection and yield estimation are critical for precision agriculture and automated harvesting systems, yet traditional methods remain prone to errors and inefficiencies, this paper presents a novel approach combining the Masked Region-based Convolutional Neural Network (Mask R-CNN) with the Path Aggregation Feature Pyramid Network (PA-FPN) and the Deep SORT algorithm for enhanced orange fruit analysis. The proposed system addresses key challenges in agricultural computer vision, including small object detection, effective occlusion handling, and preventing overcounting issues. The PA-FPN enhances feature representation through bidirectional information flow, enabling accurate localization of fruits across multiple scales. Deep SORT provides robust tracking capabilities, utilizing motion and appearance descriptors to maintain consistent object identities across video frames, thereby minimizing counting errors. The system successfully distinguishes between ripe and unripe oranges, visualizing separate yield counts with bounding box segmentation. Experimental results demonstrate superior performance compared to existing methods, achieving 95.8% detection accuracy and 92.3% counting precision on the complex orange orchard dataset. This innovative framework offers significant practical improvements for automated yield estimation in citrus orchards, contributing directly to the advancement of smart agriculture technologies.

title: Hybrid Power Optimization of Multi-Bit Flip-Flops with Clock Gating and Pulse Width Modulation
authors: A.Abinaya, Radha N, P.Malini, Babitha Lincy R, Jency Rubia J
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Timing optimization is a key objective for designers in modern VLSI systems. Memory components are crucial in digital circuits, with latches and flip-flops being the fundamental elements commonly considered during the design process. One effective approach to enhance flip-flop performance is by sharing the signal from the clock. A multi-bit flip-flop utilizes only one clock pulse to control several bits, providing precisely the same features as numerous one-bit flip-flops while reducing clock load and consumption of power. As an alternative to traditional methods, this work outlines the design of a multi-bit flip-flop that uses clock gating and pulse width modulation techniques to reduce power consumption and latency. Furthermore, a polyphase filter is implemented with both existing as well as proposed multi-bit flip-flops (MBFF), and a comparative analysis is conducted based on power usage, LUT count, and delay performance.

title: Enhancing Article Summarization using Abstractive Meta Learning
authors: Vignesh Aravind K, Praveen Kumar V, Kannadasan R
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Automatic text summarization has become a critical task in natural language processing (NLP), aiming to condense lengthy content into concise representations while preserving essential meaning. Conventional extractive methods have exhibited fair performance but commonly rely heavily on large annotated datasets and display weak adaptability from domains. In a bid to address this, this work presents an abstractive meta-learning model for emotion-aware summarization. This model leverages the generalization capability of meta-learning and abstractive generation flexibility to enable summaries with both factual accuracy and emotional content even where data is limited. Experimental evaluation confirms that the framework performs better than conventional extractive approaches at a better performance level, achieving accuracy, F1-score, and emotional relevance improvement. The results indicate the potential of meta-learning in overcoming data sparsity and enhancing cross-domain summarization performance in modern NLP applications.

title: Electricity Generation From Vehicle Engine Heat using Thermoelectric Generators
authors: Loegesh R, Jaividhya S, Nagul Prathish S, Sri Vidhya D
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: The accelerating energy demand both in the globe and the growing environmental issues have made global energy recovery solutions to be in high demand. The waste heat of internal combustion engines has been identified as a major, but underutilized, energy in vehicles. This paper describes a small and portable system that can transform engine heat into a usable electrical power through Thermoelectric Generators (TEGs). By utilizing the Seebeck effect, there are five TEG modules that are strategically placed on high-temperature engine areas in order to tap into thermal energy. A DC-DC converter stabilizes and steps up the low and fluctuating voltage output and charges batteries and drives devices. An Arduino Uno microcontroller is a device that is operated to sensor voltage, control power, and monitor in real-time, using an LCD monitor. The energy is collected and stored in a rechargeable battery and turned off DC into AC with the help of an inverter to supply low-wattage devices like LED lights. Examples of experimental outcomes indicate that the system will be effective in the recovery and re-use of the waste energy which will be viable as an auxiliary energy source. Such a solution is especially useful with hybrid and electric cars, which will lead to increased energy efficiency, decreased fuel use, and less negative impact on the environment.

title: AI-Driven Solutions for Predictive Aircraft Maintenance using Sensor Data
authors: Sravan Kumar Kalsani, G. Sudhakar, S Rajeswari, Kumari Jelli, Komuravelly Sudheer Kumar, P. Rajesh
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Predictive maintenance (PdM) uses critical functions to lower aircraft maintenance duration and create higher operational safety through early failure detection. Regular maintenance approaches regularly respond after problems arise thus leading to both unexpected maintenance work and expensive repairs. The authors develop a sensor data performing predictive aircraft maintenance strategy through artificial intelligence systems. Real-time sensor data collection and preprocessing occurs first in this model before machine learning algorithms including Random Forest, Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Neural Networks take over failure prediction processes. The research evaluates predictive aircraft maintenance models through accuracy, precision and recall and F1 score assessment using more than 10,000 aircraft engine and avionics system data points. The experimental results confirm that AI-based algorithms deliver superior results beyond traditional methods because they attain 92.5% accuracy alongside 89.3% recall during fault detection operations. The proposed method dramatically lowers the requirement for human inspections and alerts operators early about system breakdowns which enables more effective maintenance planning and reduces operational expenses. The presented work brings forth an effective solution to improve predictive maintenance capabilities for aviation applications.

title: AI-Powered Alzheimer’s Classification: A Novel Hybrid Model with Grad-CAM Interpretability
authors: Abinash P, Jagadeesan S, Venkadeshan R, Suresh A, Jaganathan J, Vetriselvi T
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Alzheimer disease (AD) remains a major global health challenge, requiring early and accurate detection for effective intervention. This research introduces a deep learning-based AD classification model using MRI scans, combining EfficientNetV2-S with a biologically inspired Spiking Neural Network (SNN) layer. The model is trained on a balanced four-class dataset (No_Impairment, Very_Mild, Mild, and Moderate_Impairment) with advanced data augmentation to improve generalization. EfficientNetV2-S serves as the feature extractor, while the SNN layer enhances discrimination through adaptive thresholding, mimicking neuronal spiking behavior. Training stability is ensured with label smoothing and gradient accumulation, while mixed precision (AMP) optimization accelerates computations. The model achieves an impressive 99% test accuracy, surpassing conventional deep learning models. Additionally, Grad-CAM visualizations highlight critical brain regions, improving interpretability and clinical applicability. This study underscores the potential of hybrid architectures for robust AD classification, paving the way for scalable, explainable AI-driven diagnostic tools. Future work will focus on real-world deployment and cross-cohort generalization.

title: Real-Time Multimodal Driver Drowsiness Detection using CNN, ViT, and rPPG
authors: Harish G, Pooja S, Magesh P, Kannadasan R
publish: 2025 9th International Conference on Electronics, Communication and Aerospace Technology (ICECA)
abstract: Driver drowsiness is one of the main reasons for road accidents and thus, there is a pressing need for precise real-time monitoring systems. This paper presents a new attention-based multimodal framework that combines Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Vision Transformers (ViTs), and remote Photoplethysmography (rPPG). CNNs sense local facial features like eye blinking and yawning, ViTs encode global contextual dependencies between facial regions, and rPPG offers non-contact physiological signals. An attention-driven fusion mechanism dynamically integrates these modalities to offer strong detection across different lighting, head poses, and motion artifacts. Experimental results show that the introduced framework outperforms unimodal and bimodal baselines in accuracy as well as robustness consistently. Also, real-time audio–visual notifications and a monitoring dashboard are implemented to improve driver safety. To our knowledge, this is the first work to combine CNN, ViT, and rPPG under an attention-guided fusion scheme for real-world drowsiness detection.

title: Comparative Analysis of Duty Cycle and Dual Phase Shift Control for CC/CV Wireless Charging in EVs Employing an Asymmetric Magnetic Coupler
authors: Joel Adubofuor, Sachin De Zoysa, Sheldon S. Williamson
publish: 2025 IEEE 10th Southern Power Electronics Conference (SPEC)
abstract: This paper presents a comparative study of two control methodologies for achieving constant-current/constantvoltage (CC/CV) charging in a level 1 wireless electric vehicle (EV) charging system employing a novel asymmetric magnetic coupler. The coupler consists of a rectangular receiver coil and two double-layer asymmetric triangular transmitter coils, each driven by a half-bridge inverter, the receiver can be a diode or an active rectifier. Both control strategies are implemented on an S-S compensated topology operating at 85 kHz with a rated power of 3.7 kW. The DPS control achieves a peak efficiency of 96% under aligned conditions and maintains 90.6% efficiency under extreme misalignment of 150 mm with negligible fluctuation in output voltage and current. In comparison, duty-cycle control achieves a peak efficiency of 90.62% under aligned conditions and 88.60% under extreme misalignment. The results demonstrate that the proposed asymmetric coupler, combined with appropriate control strategies, provides a reliable and efficient solution for level 1 wireless EV charging applications

title: Analysis of the Impact of Supercapacitors in Advanced Electric Vehicles
authors: Daman Kumar Das, Vineeth Kumar P. K., Niranjana C., Jijesh J. J., Anniruddh Guptha Depa, Amit Kumar Jena
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: The transition toward sustainable transportation heavily depends on the widespread adoption of electric vehicles (EVs). While lithium-ion batteries currently serve as the backbone of EV energy storage, they present limitations in power delivery, charge/discharge performance, and long-term durability. Supercapacitors, known for their rapid energy exchange capabilities and extended operational lifespan, have gained attention as a promising supplement to conventional battery systems. This study delves into the function and advantages of supercapacitors within electric mobility, exploring their underlying mechanisms, potential for system enhancement, and real-world integration approaches. A comparative evaluation is conducted between traditional battery-exclusive setups and hybrid configurations combining batteries with supercapacitors. The results, supported by literature insights and simulation-based analysis, reveal notable improvements in energy efficiency, regenerative braking performance, and battery longevity in hybrid systems. Overall, the findings underscore the transformative potential of supercapacitors in shaping the next generation of resilient and energy-efficient EV architectures.

title: Hybrid Metaheuristic Optimization and Graph-based Task Scheduling for Resource-Efficient Edge Computing
authors: Charles Ubagaram, Rohith Reddy Mandala, Narsing Rao Dyavani, Bhagath Singh Jayaprakasam, Khushbu Doulani, Navin Duwadi
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Ubiquitous Computing and Intelligent Information Systems (ICUIS)
abstract: Edge computing minimizes latency and enhances real-time data processing compared to traditional cloud systems. However, efficient resource management and task scheduling remain complex due to dynamic workloads, heterogeneous nodes, and limited energy budgets. This study introduces a hybrid metaheuristic optimization and graph-based scheduling framework for adaptive resource management in edge environments. The proposed system integrates quasi-Sobol optimization with sigmoid fuzzy logic to balance computational load and minimize latency, while directed acyclic graph (DAG)-based scheduling ensures dependency-aware execution across edge nodes. Adaptive optimization control strengthens scalability and responsiveness under varying workload conditions. The framework is validated through simulation using edge server datasets and evaluated based on precision, recall, F1-score, latency, and energy consumption metrics. Experimental results demonstrate significant improvements in task allocation accuracy, resource utilization, and power efficiency compared to conventional scheduling methods. The approach offers a technically robust and scalable foundation for real-time, resource-efficient task scheduling in modern edge computing applications.
